title: The Complete Infidel's Guide to the Koran-Robert Spencer
description:
It may be the most controversial book in the world. Some see it as a paean to peace; others call it a violent mandate for worldwide Islamic supremacy. How can one book lead to such dramatically different conclusions? Now, New York Times bestselling author Robert Spencer unveils the mysteries lying behind this powerful book, guiding listeners through the controversies surrounding the KoranÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s origins and its most contentious passages. Stripping out the obsolete debates, Spencer focuses on the KoranÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s decrees toward Jews, Christians, and other infidels, explaining how they were viewed in MuhammadÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s time, what theyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ve supposedly done wrong, and most important, what the Koran has in store for them.

Robert Spencer is the director of JihadWatch, a program of the David Horowitz Freedom Center. He is the author of nine books on Islam and Jihad, a weekly columnist for Human Events and the Web site Front Page Magazine, and has led numerous seminars for the U.S. Military and intelligence communities.

12 mp3 files totaling 8 hours [Unabridged]
